attributes.action: Hold a national referendum to decide whether we should lockdown, or not.
attributes.additional_details: Lockdown is an incredibly emotive and divisive topic. There appears to be many public voices speaking out against lockdown for various reasons - and yet we have been put into lockdown again, which supports only those in favour of it and ignores those who aren't. If the majority of the public support a lockdown then one should be implemented. If the majority do not support a lockdown then the Government should not be able to implement one.
attributes.background: Ask the British public one question: should we lockdown, or not. Yes/ No. Then, act on the result of that referendum.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Referendum on current restrictions and any further lockdowns: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551539

Repeal second National Lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557045

Do not implement a second national lockdown or other restrictions this winter: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549862
